website_summaries.verdict: Solid and more comfortable than many U-shaped pillows. There are several ways to set up and use this travel pillow.
pros: Unlike competing models, this one provides a generous amount of full lateral support for the upper body
cons: Some consumers say that the back strap for this pillow blocked the TVs or trays of passengers behind them

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pillow specifically for my trip to Asia. With almost 24 hours of traveling, the travelrest pillow saved me. It was easy to inflate and material is comfortable. I love that it's so compact. I went to three countries and used it every single leg. I even used it in a long car rides as well. The only reason why I'm not giving it a five start, was because there was a defect on the stopper. However, I reached out to the company, and they will send me another one. I can't wait to take the new one my next trip, which is next week.
customer_reviews.author: Nyer Val

customer_reviews.title: This was the best travel pillow ever
customer_reviews.text: This was the best travel pillow ever. It worked perfectly on the plane and while we were cruising on a motor coach around Spain it came in handy again. I wanted to tell people on the plane using different brands that they were missing out but I decided they would notice how relaxed I was with my travel pillow. Again perfect travel pillow.
customer_reviews.author: AnitaW, Los Angeles, CA.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible let down
customer_reviews.text: Terrible pillow. I wanted this to work so badly but it just doesn't. There was no way this was actually going to stay wrapped around the back of the chair (it wants to slide all over) and still stay snug against you. It was terribly uncomfortable. I tried flipping it every which way. I had to deflate it by 15% to make it a little squishy, flip it upside down, and hug it like a regular neck pillow to make it useable. I didn't even bother using it on the 8hr return flight. I would have returned it if I didn't miss the return window. Total let down.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael C.

customer_reviews.title: Deflates Without Notice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow in preparation for a recent 13.5 hour flight, hopeful that it would help me sleep while in flight. I am a side sleeper, and have trouble getting to sleep in a chair. I was optimistic. But I noticed that the pillow kept deflating while in the air. I continuously blew more air into the pillow over and over again throughout the entire flight, but within 10 minutes, the pillow would slowly deflate more and more, waking me from my sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M

customer_reviews.title: I recommend
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot before buying this gadget, when I found this one, I read all the reviews and based on them, I thought it was worth trying. I bought and tested it on a long international trip. Loved it!!! The only thing, however, is that it moves the seat a little further, which was not a problem for me, as I was with my husband. I managed to sleep a good part of the trip, which had never happened before without using this gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Kotchetkoff

customer_reviews.title: I Slept!
customer_reviews.text: The only other travel pillow I've owned was the same one everyone else seems to have...puffy, around the neck. It never worked me. For my most recent red-eye flight (I desperately wanted to sleep), I thought I'd give this a go as it seemed to receive many recommendations. And now it has mine. I did sleep and my head didn't wobble all about. Easy to blow up and deflate. Packs flat & didn't take up much room & room is important because I travel w/ a laptop & the contents of my house. A fellow passenger had also seen it advertised & was curious to know what I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING, LIFE SAVING PILLOW!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite invention from the last decade. Instapot be damned. This pillow allowed me to sleep, REALLY sleep, like good sleep, in the middle seat on a 15 hour flight to India. I slept 8 hours. That’s never happened to me on any previous flight. I owe my lack of jet lag all to this pillow. Hit the ground running in India and had energy to spare after a restful flight. It was super easy to inflate and set up and is extremely comfy to sleep on. So, so happy I found this pillow!!!
customer_reviews.author: ZokiB

customer_reviews.title: Nice travel, compact size
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hoping it would be much more portable than the memory foam one I lugged all around Japan. It fits nicely in one of my stuff sacks, isn't too heavy and I'll be able to bring it backpacking around Europe so I'm really excited to use it. I tried it sitting against a wall and it seems like its going to do much better than the other pillow i had too!
customer_reviews.author: Jera Sky

customer_reviews.title: I needed to fuss with it though to get it in a good position, but when I got it into a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a flight to Europe. It was definitely an improvement over the U-shaped travel pillow. I needed to fuss with it though to get it in a good position, but when I got it into a good position, it was comfortable and helped to keep my head from dropping forward. Being inflatable is a plus, it rolled up and stored nicely. I would recommend this pillow. It's not a perfect solution , but a worthy travel accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M. Nowak

customer_reviews.title: It honestly is the best travel pillow I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best travel pillow I've ever used, no doubt about it. The valve to inflate / deflate the pillow is perfect... it really does fully inflate with 2-3 puffs without straining yourself like those inflatables used in a pool. It took a bit to adjust to a position I liked, but only because I hadn't tried it out before I got on the place. I'd suggest you sit at home and adjust it and your experience on the plane will be great. I flew from Vancouver to Ottawa on an overnight flight, and slept the entire way without issue using this pillow. I'm looking forward to using it on my over the pacific flights coming up.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable on an Aeroplane
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, these things don't work at all on an airplane. There's just not enough room in those cattle-car seats to get it adjusted to a point where it's any where near comfortable or effective. They were actually so uncomfortable, for both my wife and myself, that we preferred to put them away and use the stupid, nearly worthless pillows the airline gives you. Unfortunately, we ordered two and by the time we got back, it was too late to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Christian

customer_reviews.title: Thank You Mr. Travelrest
customer_reviews.text: I want to thank the inventor of this pillow. It is the ONLY thing that allows me to sleep on a plane. (Before I had this, if I fell asleep, I fell over, and that woke me up.) It works. It rolls up very small so it doesn't take up to much room in your carry-on or back pack. It also blows up quickly and easily, and deflates just as quickly and easily to put away. There is a video on You Tube to show you how to use it. I generally don't put the cord around the top of chair, Instead, I wear it like a cross-body bag. Works well for me that way and it's easy.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Lady

customer_reviews.title: Kind of Okay
customer_reviews.text: I tried this for a long haul flight, and could only get it to work when worn as a messenger bag. The loop was just too small to go around the “wings” of the seat of the flight I was on. It was fine, but doesn’t provide much support. I will say that it doesn’t take up much space when deflated, and it’s easy to inflate. I got about 2 hours of sleep on an 11 hour overnight flight. I have a long flight coming up in a couple of months, and I’ll probably try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Shea Butter

customer_reviews.title: Facial hair beware!
customer_reviews.text: Made my face sweat and pinched my beard. I bought this for a 12 hour flight to Hawaii. I was excited to use the pillow. I quickly found out that this isn’t for me. - even fully inflated it will flex and grab facial hair. Every time I would shift it would grab my facial hair. - made my face sweat. It’s rubber with a felt cover. It does not breath at all.
customer_reviews.author: Goodie

customer_reviews.title: It was just ok.... The strap ...
customer_reviews.text: It was just ok....The strap helps it stay put but my head was still bobbing around and to the front mostly. The part at the bottom is kinda weird in the seat and forget about even using this on a Spirit Flight. I mean...who flys them anyway?...Are they still around??...But my point anaywyas is that its just kinda weird and ok but kinda lets me sleep but kinda not.
customer_reviews.author: 阿曼达

customer_reviews.title: Takes a bit to get used to but versatile
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few different styles of on the airplane pillows, and I like this one so far. The best part is that it collapses into a flat piece. The other bulky type that I had previously was so bulky that I promptly forgot it at the airport. When you're deary eyes, lacking sleep, the last thing you need is a bulky pillow unless you plan on wearing it around your neck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Consumer

customer_reviews.title: The pillow I would never be without!
customer_reviews.text: I am a road warrior— traveling Internationally every other week. This is the best travel pillow I have ever found. It rolls up very small — the last thing any frequent traveler needs is one more thing to carry! The only complaint I have is that for some reason my lab dog likes this pillow too and has chewed up a few! I have used these pillows for many years and have never had one fail on its own. I recommend it highly!
customer_reviews.author: 1redhen

customer_reviews.title: Must have for road trip
customer_reviews.text: This pillow was WONDERFUL for a long road trip. It fills up very fast, in just a few breaths, and also deflates very quickly after use. I inflated to about 80% and found that was perfect for me. I kept it in the glove compartment and we would fill for use as needed, and deflate and roll it back up when done. It rolls up to be very compact, and with the ease of filling and deflating, was very easy and convenient to use. We make a 17 hour road trip (each way) a couple times a year to visit family, and this has made car naps so awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great for side sleepers!
customer_reviews.text: I debated quite a bit over which travel pillow to purchase and I'm really glad I purchased this one. I secure the snap on the end and wear it like a sling purse. That makes it stable enough that I can lean my head against it and have a good snooze. If you like to sleep on your side (which I do) it feels very natural to lean your head over and rest it against the pillow. I had a very comfortable sleep on a recent trip. It is easy to blow up and deflate and folds up into a small package.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Bosco

customer_reviews.title: Good cushioning and better with memory foam cover!
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these for my daughter and I for a trip to Europe. We have economy seats and have no idea where they will be, so I am preparing for the worst! I sifted through reviews before getting these. I think the strap the attach to seat back as well as the cover with memory foam that can be purchased separately will work well blows up quickly and the cushioning seems good
customer_reviews.author: CRK

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended For Air Travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an Overseas Long Flight. However, I could find a Comfortable place to rest my head. Might work better in a car.
customer_reviews.author: Tina L Perkins

customer_reviews.title: ... plane rides during the year and this is the best neck rest/ travel pillow I have found
customer_reviews.text: I do multiple 10+ hour plane rides during the year and this is the best neck rest/ travel pillow I have found! I even lost one in travel and as soon as I got home, I ordered another. For me, I can't keep my neck straight up and down while trying to sleep on a plane, so this makes it so much more comfortable for me since I'm able to tilt my head and switch sides as needed. I also purchased the soft cover that goes over this, which I highly recommend because it makes it much softer and even more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Clifford

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and strange
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable, strange pillow. Myt husband and I used two of these on a trans-Atlantic trip last month. We both used it on the way over, and he refused to even try his on the way back. Unless you can strap your pillow around the back of your seat (which we couldn't), I don't see how this could ever be comfortable. Because I had a window seat, I used it on the way home but no differently than I would have used any pillow propped against the window. Moreover, when you are blowing it up in front of people, it gradually rises from your lap in a most disturbing way...
customer_reviews.author: M. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Skeptic turned SUPER FAN
customer_reviews.text: This thing is THE BEST. I had very low expectations and I was wrong. Neck pillows are terrible because they are lumpy, push you out from the seat, and take up valuable space/weight for packing. This thing is soft, comfy, quick to inflate, and super easy to use. I tested mine out early at home while watching tv in various positions to be sure there were no holes/leaks, and that it was worth it. Consider me sold! Will be buying a second one for my spouse. If these don't hold up to our trip, I'll definitely update my review.
customer_reviews.author: J review

customer_reviews.title: Great gift, great investment for long trips!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a friend traveling internationally with a group of people. When she returned she said it was the best gift EVER. While her travel companions on the plane all had the usual C sleep pillows, they noticed my friend resting so comfortably on their long flights, they started referring to it as her “wubby”. They were all envious and wished they too had a “wubby”. Had to buy another one for my mom for a long upcoming trip. I will be getting another for an additional gift too! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ease to carry
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I have used other travel pillows but have had to tote them through the airport clumsily. This pillow is quick to deflate and attaches to the handles of my carry on and I never have to think of it til I want to use it again. I also like having something to wrap my arms around and hug, especially if I'm cold. I've told all my fellow travelers and thus found out about the soft pillow cover so I bought it too.
customer_reviews.author: SAR

customer_reviews.title: Why do I bother...?
customer_reviews.text: Point one - nothing about this thing suggests any real level of comfort. If you look at the picture (assuming it's the woman in the dark blue chair with this thing "resting" on her shoulder) you might notice that she is not applying any weight whatsoever to this, anywhere. Having used this on four different airplanes recently, I can tell you that nothing about the situation makes any sense whatsoever. Point two - there is an edge around the entire thing. It's hard and uncomfortable. That being said this does okay as a sort of arm rest. I literally cannot find any other use for it. Kind of annoying, vastly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: KhouriTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best option out there, but still a 3 star
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best option out there, but I know there is still room for improvement. I recently went on a trip to Germany from Los Angeles, about 12-14 hours. This helped some, but had to adjust it's placement from time to time. Part of the problem with airline seating is that your butt and feet get tired and you constantly have to shift positions. So moving this thing to the other side is a little bit of a hassle to have get into the right position. It is definitely better than other options we had on hand - SkyRest travel pillow (2 star), Trlt Pillow (scarf - zero stars) and horseshoe pillow (good for putting feet on.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C

customer_reviews.title: This actually WORK!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought lots of neck pillows and none of them ever worked. Neck pillows with Memory foam, gel beads, etc, the ones that go around my neck did nothing. This one is very versatile and actually works. I’m very small so it’s hard to find something that works for a 110LB female, 40Lb child, and 200lb man. This one does it all. I’m buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Giang Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: horrible. was falling off all the time
customer_reviews.text: horrible.was falling off all the time.it was impossible to use it and sleep on it,no matter how hard I tried.waste.absolute waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Elena A

customer_reviews.title: Hope the tie works better so it won't move around
customer_reviews.text: I bought this inflatable pillow in 2014 and used it for two trips. I liked it. During a flight in 2015 when I first used it, the cap somehow popped out and was lost on the plane so I wasn't able to use the pillow. I did not have the chance to solve this until much later when I called the company. They were very nice and helpful and shipped me a new replacement. I used it once so far. It worked ok. It would be more stable if I could somehow fix the tie on the seat more firmly. It is definitely helpful for long trips especially.
customer_reviews.author: Celest Love

customer_reviews.title: Solves the "Where to put my arms?" question!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pillow! In fact, I loved it so much I bought a second one for my daughter so I could have mine back. We both like that it doesn't push your head forward like a typical U-shaped pillow. I'm also one who is always looking for someplace to put my hands, so this gives me something to hold while I nap. It also doesn't interfere with earbuds. The new valve design is great because it makes customizing the fit a snap. The only thing I would change is the material. I would like for it to be a bit plusher, but don't let that stop you from trying out this odd, yet SUPER comfortable travel pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Joelle Dodge

customer_reviews.title: I don't get it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow thinking it would be perfect for using on planes where there's nothing to lean sideways against. However, it just isn't designed well enough to use any way except as shown in the photo. Using as shown, all you're really getting is a place to rest your arm. If you try to use it under your arm and shoulder, you're fighting the curve of the neck piece. I tried using it half-inflated, but that doesn't work either. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: I love this pillow
customer_reviews.text: For the first time, I'm able to sleep on a plane, and it's because of this pillow. It took me a few flights before I figured out how to make the best use of it Because you can inflate it as much or as little as you want, and because you can bend it or not, it gives you lots of options. I assume most people could find one that would work for them. This plus a window seat so that I can lean against the window: it's my new formula for getting some sleep on a long flight.
customer_reviews.author: MK74

customer_reviews.title: storing it is easy and your neck will thank you
customer_reviews.text: Adore this pillow. Using it is a breeze, storing it is easy and your neck will thank you. Never had such a deliciously restful sleep on a plane. Easy to deflate for a connecting flight and re-inflate for the next. Not bulky like other pillows. A pleasure to use. I purchased the cover in addition to the pillow. Pleased with it as well. Will be taking this pillow with my whenever and wherever I go. Looking forward to using it it my car as a passenger.
customer_reviews.author: P. R. Mass

customer_reviews.title: Body pillow for a plane
customer_reviews.text: I’ve taken this pillow on 4 flights 8+ hours each and loved it! If you’re a side sleeper, this pillow helped to mimic a body pillow on the plane. I did have trouble getting it to hang on the headrest, but put the straps over my shoulder instead. Works great if you have a middle or aisle seat; no window to lean against. Inflates & deflates easily.
customer_reviews.author: Zoomzoom

customer_reviews.title: Great concept head rest
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for international long distance travel. I loved it my first trip to Ireland. It has an unusual valve to blow up. It proved difficult to blow up this trip and I could not get the valve to close, so several attempts proved problematic and I couldn’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: ImeldaM

customer_reviews.title: Great for long haul flights
customer_reviews.text: I have had the privilege to travel a lot in my life. The 14+ hour long haul flights are brutal. Just bought this and found it to be *much* better than those standard horseshoe shaped pillows. The adjustable cords are a little awkward, and the air intake/output valve is also big (about 1 inch around and hard plastic). But with a little bit of adjusting it made for the most restful long flight I have ever taken.
customer_reviews.author: angela b

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to order from travel rest not the "counterfeit"
customer_reviews.text: This was ordered for a long flight coming later this year, so I haven't used it on the plane yet but it is comfortable. Just don't let it sit your bare shoulder. I will update my review later. I think it'll work just fine for you if your head doesn't tend to slum forward while sleeping in a chair/airplane seat (mine tends to tilt to the side). Also, make sure you order from travel rest because IMO the defective pillows are coming from other sellers. If by chance your pillow needs customer service, you're not going to regret paying a couple of dollars extra to deal with their awesome reps.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepy catsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not good on flight
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was excited to use this product for my flight to Europe. Tried it out at home, and it seemed great...even bought one for my mom to use. However, it was extremely uncomfortable and almost impossible to use because of the headrest on international flights/larger planes. Tried different positions, different inflation amounts, nothing worked and I was extremely disappointed. The seam in the middle is also uncomfortable
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long haul flights!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product four years ago on my first long haul flight to Southwest Asia. It was perfect! My husband kept trying to take it as he had bought a tradional donut style pillow. We are flying again this year and I immediately went to storage to get it out. It is still working and material is very soft. I am a planner and research every item to buy for a trip. This is a must have ( and I’m buying my husband one for this flight)!
customer_reviews.author: An Hung Yeh

customer_reviews.title: Soft and durable
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited to try this! I had a cheapie inflatable pillow in the past, and I can already tell that this one is softer, higher quality, and more comfortable. 1. The texture is nice and soft and doesn't feel 'plastic-y' at all 2. The mouthpiece for inflation/deflation is large, so it only takes a few breaths 3. It buttons up into a convenient travel size (as small as my hand) 4. It comes with attached rope that you can wrap around yourself or the chair to steady the pillow
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Perrine

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a long, overnight flight hoping that I would be able to get some sleep. I liked that it was easy to inflate and deflate and compact to carry, but just did not work for me at all. I couldn't find a comfortable position and felt like my neck was in a weird and uncomfortable angle no matter how much air I added or removed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Demarco

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to inflate but took some tries to get in ...
customer_reviews.text: First time to use this pillow. Was easy to inflate but took some tries to get in the best position to use. Was much better than horseshoe shaped pillow and definitely better than pillow provided on the plane. Use on 8 hr flight from USA to Europe and both of use enjoyed having it. I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Mazza

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Travelrest pillow and cover back in 2016. It is absolutely amazing! I tried a number of different neck pillows but still found it uncomfortable to sleep on flights. This pillow addressed the fact that my head droops when in a seated position. No more neck pain! And because my chin rests on the pillow, no more snoring either! Easy to carry-on, I typically have it deflated and rolled up in my bag. Very easy to inflate/deflate. The cover is a must have for me, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: DeeDubbs

customer_reviews.title: It is Pillow
customer_reviews.text: I was prepared to be amazed it isn't amazing it is pillow that can attach to your seat, and if you can sleep sitting up and crammed into coach then this might do it for you. Folds down real small, but truly isn't any better than those things you blow up and put around your neck.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Fits Like a HUG -- great for wheelchairs!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered pillow to test for use on my son's wheelchair. He naps regularly in his wheelchair and chair headrest just doesn't really support his head. This pillow is the perfect answer. It actually is like a hug for him all day long. He can rest his head, hug the pillow back, Sleep with support. I would like to see if there is another way of attaching at the top other than by strings, perhaps a wider band or belt that is adjustable. Maybe include interchangeable string, belt depending on where/how it is being used. I ordered a second one for him to have at school too. Highly recommend this product..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Flexible Travel Pillow
customer_reviews.text: My son and I used two Travelrest Ultimate Travel Pillows when we traveled recently on a late-night flight. The pillows packed very easily and took up little room in our bag. They were very easy to inflate, and though they looked a bit strange, they worked very well. You can use the pillow in a few different configurations, and both my son and I found a set up that we each liked. Deflating and storing the pillow at the end of the flight was also a snap. We're quite pleased with these pillows, and now keep them in the middle row in our family SUV for the kids to use on long trips.
customer_reviews.author: John Canales

customer_reviews.title: This was the perfect pillow for long haul travel for our family
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect pillow for long haul travel for our family! It rolls up small for when we travel with carry on only luggage. It is simple and quick to inflate and deflate. And the comfort - we definitely had to bargain for who got to use this pillow! It is ideal for those spots where you don't have a wall to lay on. It makes the aisle and middle seats much more comfortable. Sleeping at airports where every single stinking chair has armrests is now possible. I'm going to have to buy a second one before our next trip!
customer_reviews.author: Zanne's Plans

customer_reviews.title: Good use
customer_reviews.text: I just used this on my trip to Miami. I was skeptical at first but I became pleasantly surprised after using it. You can blow and air it up to your own comfort level. That's a nice plus. Secondly, I was able to put it between my wife and I and we BOTH rested on it and used it. That's a hidden plus. It folds up very compact and I will take it on every trip now.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Bell

customer_reviews.title: Best travel pillow I have found anywhere
customer_reviews.text: I was not really sure that this pillow would work but it got good reviews so I thought I would try it. I LOVE it! I have trouble sleeping on planes and have tried all sort of pillows. None have worked, until I got a travelrest. It is comfortable and easy to use. Best of all, instead of carrying around a big stuffed collar, the travelrest deflates and rolls neatly up so I can attach it to the handle of my carry on. I bought the optional cover with foam pads and love that too. My husband had pillow envy and had to get a travelrest too! It is a great travel pillow and perfect for long flights.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Ease of inflation.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow for my wife for . Christmas. She is going on a 13 hour flight in January.The round neck pillow were bulky and not comfortable at all. After reading the reviews and talking to Teri I am sure this will be a lifesaver for her. She could never sleep before and always arrived tired. I am looking forward to letting her inflate and try it before her flight. I also bought the cover which makes the pillow that more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Larry J Lane

customer_reviews.title: Best Inflatable Travel Pillow
customer_reviews.text: I have finally found a travel pillow that is comfortable, easy to inflate, and not a big bulky carry-on that just takes up room. I have had other inflatables but had given up on those as they just didn't fit right and it didn't take long for them to somehow have a pin hole that gradually deflated in route. Found that this pillow had good reviews so decided to try an inflatable again and haven't been disappointed. Now I look forward to using it in a long trip going international air. Oh yes, also good for long trips in an automobile.
customer_reviews.author: PUNKYB

customer_reviews.title: Compact, super easy to inflate/deflate, and provides good support
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is small when deflated, and super quick to inflate (couple breaths) or deflate (push button fast deflate). You can loop the top string around the bottom snap-loop and sling it over your shoulder to keep it from getting away from you. I like being able to cross my arms over it. Have used on multiple overseas trips, and work trips, like it much better than traditional U-shaped neck pillows. I usually have trouble sleeping upright (not having enough support) but this does the trick. You can also get a soft cover if you're so inclined.
customer_reviews.author: K S

customer_reviews.title: Great travel accessory
customer_reviews.text: Just took this travel pillow on a trip and it was excellent. Easy to inflate and deflate, and I was able to sleep even though I was in the middle seat. I easily adjusted the pillow when I was watching a movie. Nicely rolled up so I could stuff it into my tote.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wong-Lau

customer_reviews.title: No more flopping arms or bobbing head!
customer_reviews.text: The travel rest pillow is really neat. We take driving trips and are in the car for 12 hours at a time. When I'm in the car I get tired and drop off to sleep (ONLY when I'm in the passenger seat of course!) but I can never get comfortable and constantly wake up. If I fall into a deep sleep my head bobs and my arms never get comfortable. This is really cool because you can rest your wrist at the bottom in the little snap-slot and can just relax without the wrist "dropping" and waking you up, and the pillow is like your side-sleeping with no head-bobbing. Sounds weird but it really does work. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jean C.

customer_reviews.title: Travels easily
customer_reviews.text: This travel pillow is light weight, easy to carry, and inflates and deflates very quickly. It’s much easier to travel with than the U shaped neck pillows that I find very uncomfortable. I gave four stars because it takes a bit of time to learn what position personally works best. I had a delivery problem with a pillow cover and found the company to be most helpful providing exceptional service.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Number 1 for a reason
customer_reviews.text: This is a great travel pillow. I purchased this for long flights to Europe. It folds up and is small and compact for carry on luggage. It is easy to inflate and deflate. I was not sure that I would like an inflatable pillow, but it allows you to control the firmness. I think this is a great pillow for a side sleeper. The J shape of the pillow wraps around you and is very cozy. Another nice feature is the cord to put around the headrest to keep the pillow in place. Best sleep I have had on a plane and no neck pain!
customer_reviews.author: SassyPants

customer_reviews.title: not the one to buy
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews but because I constantly see this as a "best" i decided to add my two cents. This is not a good pillow for air travel. it does not stay put, easily and it's quite long. try something else
customer_reviews.author: km

customer_reviews.title: Travel pillow that is easy to carry and easy to inflate with a variety of uses
customer_reviews.text: The travel pillow is remarkable. It has the ability to be easily carried in a purse or back pack and quickly inflates with just a few puffs of air. It provides secure support when using as a neck rest which is important to me as I have arthritis in my neck. I also have lower back problems and the best part about it is that is not only usable as a headrest in the car or airplane, but I am able to use it as a back support in booths at restaurants, seats in sports stadiums etc. So I not only carry this when I travel, but it is in my purse all of the time.
customer_reviews.author: SaraLee

customer_reviews.title: Truly The Ultimate Travel Pillow
customer_reviews.text: This travel pillow works so much better than the conventional horseshoe shaped pillows. It is easy to blow up and you can control the firmness by letting out small amounts of air untill you have it just right for you.After back surgery and cervical spine problems I have to have support on my neck when traveling and this pillow does it best. It rolls up when deflated and can be attached to the handle of your carry on without taking up hardly any space. To me this is the perfect solution to making travel more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Pillow Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I travel frequently and am rarely able to sleep well on long flights. I've tried the classic neck pillow as well as a number of other styles but nothing really worked. Until I bought the Travelrest Inflatable Neck Pillow. I know this sounds like an advertisement, but this pillow works! I'm a side sleeper, and I've tried other "side sleeper" pillows before. What makes the Travelrest stand out is its unique design - because it extends down and across my body I can truly get comfortable. Thank you Travelrest! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dalia A Taft

customer_reviews.title: Great product and service
customer_reviews.text: I travel internationally quite frequent. Cannot afford business class on every trip. As a light sleeper, I constantly looking for neck support pillows that will help me sleep upright. Travrest ultimate travel pillow provide just the right amount of support for someone like me, prefer aisle seat and sleep on the side only. It only takes two or three breath to inflate, holds air nicely for the entire flight. After a few trips, one of the cord lock broke off. I contacted the customer service. They offer me a replacement. The company offers efficient and friendly service. I am very pleased with both the product and the service.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, versatile and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with the  and am very happy about the purchase. It's very comfortable to sleep on and feels nice to the touch. I love how you can either attach to the chair or wear it as a harness. You can use it to either lean left or right depending on what's more comfortable for you. It is very easy to blow up, deflate and fold.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Olshansky

customer_reviews.title: BEST TRAVEL COMPANION EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is an AMAZING travel essential. I travel 50% for work and have never found a better pillow companion. It's compact, it's lightweight, stays inflated, and is WAY WAY better than those neck pillows they sell at the airport. I've already gotten another three people to purchase them because they loved mine so much. The pillow alone is very comfortable, but the pillow cover is worth the extra cost to make washing it easier, and takes this A+ product to an A++ product.
customer_reviews.author: Joci

customer_reviews.title: It was ok
customer_reviews.text: This pillow might be more comfortable if you have a window seat. Unfortunately I need to sit on the aisle. This pillow inflates and deflates quickly. I liked that aspect of it. What i didn't like is this, if I put it on the aisle side of my seat people walking by kept bumping me. If I put it on the side with a seat next to me I felt like I was using their space. Since I was traveling alone that wasn't really comfortable for me. If you are traveling with someone else that won't mind your pillow leaning on them or you take a window seat it's a nice way to sleep on a plane.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Vendrell

customer_reviews.title: Great flight head pillow!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great investment. I bought before a 14 hour economy flight and it definitely improved my experience. Easy to inflate (3 puffs and done). Easy to deflate (I adjusted mine throughout to meet the need of my head position). And then easy to pack up. I sat by the window on my flights but I used it one way near the window and on the rerun flight away from the window and it was great! Didn’t interfere with the person next to me. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Best pillow for side sleepers
customer_reviews.text: I’m a side sleeper, so I get a window seat and use this. It is the best sleep I can get in a plane. Plus it takes no space! When I deflate it, I just wrap it around my purse’s handle. My first one lasted about 2 years and I was traveling every month. I loved it so much that I bought another.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: ... wife and I travel quite a bit and a good head rest is vital
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I travel quite a bit and a good head rest is vital. I have looked at other products and this one intrigued me and when they arrived, I realized this would be great for travel. The service was speedy, the product is ingenious, and if I can sleep sitting almost upright, what more could you ask for. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Ranger Rod

customer_reviews.title: Best travel pillow that i have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I have been traveling for over 40 years during which time i have bought over 20 travel pillows. I've bought cheap ones and i've bought very expensive ones. But none quite did the trick. I am happy to say that i have finally found a pillow that actually allows me to sleep on a plane. It is by far the best pillow that i have ever used. Brilliant in so many ways. It folds flat and inflates incredibly easily. Stop looking - seriously. It's brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a travel pillow that works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I've dreaded overseas flights in the past. I couldn't get comfortable and relax enough to sleep with the airline pillow or ubiquitous "C"-shaped neck pillow. But travelling recently with the inflatable Travelrest pillow changed all that. Between its compact uninflated size, the ergonomic shape, and the "leash" that attaches to the seat's headrest, it met all my expectations -- AND allowed me to relax and fall asleep on a 12+ hour flight without disturbing the passenger in the seat next to me. From now on, I won't be travelling without it.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Felten

customer_reviews.title: great travel pillow!
customer_reviews.text: This item was perfect for my flight. I paired it with the Trtl pillow so I had a pillow for both sides of my head on 1 leg of the flight. I used it individually on the other leg. It's a fantastic pillow. I'll be buying another one for my husband to use as well. We also plan to take these on long car rides. It was super easy to inflate and deflate. Definitely recommend. Worth getting the cover for it as well, it added even more cushion to the pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Jem

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead and get it. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a side sleeper. I looked for something similar but cheaper and couldn't find anything. I had a 14 hour flight to India. Slept like a baby on the way over. The flight back was another story, but the lack of sleep wasn't due to the pillow. It was more expensive than I would have liked, but I don't regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Worked really well.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical when I first opened this, but I used it for awhile on the couch to see how it worked and it was extremely ergonomic AND comfortable. It was . Then, I used it for a trip to Venice on a 8+ hour flight. Worked really well. I never really needed to use the strap but it could come in handy depending on your need to adjust the fit. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle

customer_reviews.title: This pillow doesn't deliver on its promises.
customer_reviews.text: Taking into consideration both the many positive reviews as well as the less positive ones, I purchased this pillow for an upcoming overseas trip. Unfortunately, the pillow doesn't deliver on its promises. I tried it in the car, and in a seat that's similar to one found on an airplane, and could not find a way to feel comfortable with it. The many positive reviewers must have a different body type. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Carpediem1948

customer_reviews.title: Easy inflate and adjustment
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this pillow is the quick inflate and adjustable deflate. I never had a blow-up pillow that did as well on this aspect. The shape is different, but it worked just fine for me on a recent trip to Europe. Since it deflates to a small size, it is easy to take along. The positioning features are not so remarkable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: much preferred over circular neck pilow
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Love this pillow!!! Had my first for about six years. It finally broke and I couldn't be happier to support this business by buying another! //////// I've never liked travel pillows. They've not quite worked for my neck. I herniated a disc in my neck years ago and need to have a nice arc at the back. This pillow allows for many variations and made a 17 hr flight to Hong Kong a DREAM. As noted in other reviews, the key is not to over inflate. But in addition to a sleep pillow it can also be used to assist the lower back, mid back or even used as an arm rest. GREAT product!
customer_reviews.author: T. Tamsen

customer_reviews.title: Poor product that doesn't function as stated.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Offers very little support. We threw it out after 24 hrs flying from Florida to Vietnam. It was awful and a pain to use and deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Staci Lewis White

customer_reviews.title: Wanted it to work
customer_reviews.text: Womp. I searched and searched for a travel pillow for an overnight flight to the UK. It was my first overnight flight so I wanted to make sure I had something good. I had high hopes for this thing and it just didn't work. I got one for my husband and myself and neither of us were able to successfully use it. Great idea, but it didn't stay put, it kept falling off of my shoulder. I did like wrapping my arms around it but I just ended up using the pillow thing build into my seat. So disappointed. Will try another product for our next flight.
customer_reviews.author: Arod4Real

customer_reviews.title: Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Really looking forward to my flight so I can try it out. If I remember, I'll update this review with my impressions. Overall, the quality is good and had no problems inflating quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Best flight ever--I actually could rest comfortably for a change.
customer_reviews.text: This, along with the cover, made for a wonderful cross-pacific trip. For the first time, I could actually get some sleep, without a crippling neck ache after. I had a window seat for both legs, so I don't know how well this would work without side support, but it was wonderfully adaptive and comfortable. I slung the string over my shoulder and down my back and it stayed in place pretty well. It was so easy to inflate, quickly, and adjust the softness (and deflate for landing). It folds up nicely for carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Mann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pillow and excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: As a frequent traveler I love using this pillow. I have tried other travel pillows that leave me with neck pain at the worst possible time but this pillow has delivered comfort each time I use it. I also must comment on their customer service- I had an issue with the new soft cover not fitting properly and the company owner personally made sure that I was satisfied with the fit. If I could give more than 5 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: debrad52

customer_reviews.title: Recently used on international flights and was definitely more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Recently flew to Ukraine, then Amsterdam, then Boston, then back to NC. Used this, especially on the international legs and I was pleasantly surprised. It's not perfect, what is, but given that you don't have much room and not many options, this is definitely one of the more comfortable pillows I've tried, and I've tried many because I travel quite a bit. I also really like the fact it comes across your chest so I can curl my arms around it. Feels more natural to me than those little neck things. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Koop

customer_reviews.title: Get this one
customer_reviews.text: Paradoxically, this pillow that offers very little contact with your head or neck provides better and more comfortable support than the other products I have used, all of which look like they would provide more support. It rolls up small enough for purse, backpack, or briefcase. It inflates in about three normal breaths, and getting the air out to pack it back up is easy too. It stays in place without being managed. It barely gives you something to lean your head against, yet it provides exactly what is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett Barouch

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit for me
customer_reviews.text: Traveled to India - Didn’t work well for me. Could not get comfortable and it kept slipping - odd fit I borrowed friends donut for a more comfortable fit during the first leg of my flight
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Great design and the only pillow that works for me!
customer_reviews.text: It may look a little strange at first, but if you are a side sleeper (like I am), this travel pillow is genius! Blows up easy with just a few breaths and then deflates quickly and can be rolled into a tiny roll for storage. Very well designed to support your head and felt best blown up to about 80% full. I'd also recommend attaching the top and bottom strap together and putting it over your shoulder and under your arm. This keeps you from having to attach it to the seat directly. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: buyingonline

customer_reviews.title: OK...Hoped it Would Be More Comfortable...
customer_reviews.text: I thought that this product since it is designed differently would be a better option. Shall we just say I am a large chested person and it just didn't work that well. What drew me to this option was the fact that it rolled up to pack and also that it wasn't around the back of my neck while sleeping. I have since found a memory foam item that has cooling gel in it and it works much better but I do have to carry it and it's large.
customer_reviews.author: Curlz

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Pillow
customer_reviews.text: I used this on an 8-hour flight to Germany and it was very comfortable for sleeping. I was happy to not be one of those people walking through the airport with a pillow stuck to the back of my neck. This one folds up very small and is easy to inflate and deflate. I do recommend watching the short online video to understand how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol B

customer_reviews.title: Best "flight" of sleep in my life!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life? I had the best "flight" of sleep in my life with this travel pillow. I find it much more comfortable than the U-shaped ones that press your neck forward and fail to adequately support your head on the side. I love that it is inflatable because that means it packs down small, so that as soon as the flight is down I dont have a giant pillow to lug around. And you can also then control how firm or soft it is when you are sleeping on it. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: E. Mcdonnell

customer_reviews.title: Good for long flights
customer_reviews.text: Easy to inflate. Worked for me during long flight, not too great for wife. She was not as comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Travelrest......
customer_reviews.text: We were flying to Australia a 14 hour flight. We bought two online...the first one broke and the button to push broke and slipped inside, spent more time messing with it, trying to make it work. It wasn't very comfortable either. I ended up buying one of those other kind of pillows on the way back. I spent more time messing with the pillow. It wasnt comfortable, and I preferred the C shaped ones available at the airport. It was not very comfy.
customer_reviews.author: NWJo

customer_reviews.title: It's completely different from the usual neck pillows - I was able to sleep comfortably with my head in either direction
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this inflatable pillow because I was going to be stuck with a middle seat for a long flight. It absolutely saved me. Uninflated it was compact enough to fit in my handbag. It's completely different from the usual neck pillows - I was able to sleep comfortably with my head in either direction, and when I was awake it provided a perfect armrest for holding my book. I would not take another flight without it, even if I have my usual sleep-friendly window seat.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy

customer_reviews.title: At last, an easy to carry sleep pillow that works on a red eye.
customer_reviews.text: All the way to Fiji and back. At last a pillow that works and folds up easily to store while on holiday. I did not buy the cover since I wanted no extra bulk in my bag BUT know it would make it more comfortable. Didn’t give it a five for durability because I’m not sure yet how durable it will be however I bought two for Christmas presents because I like it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Never traveling without this
customer_reviews.text: This is the first neck pillow that's really worked for me. I took it on a two month trip that involved lots of cramped flights and was honestly a lifesaver. Let me sleep in aisle seats that are normally incredibly uncomfortable for me. So glad I made this purchase and I won't shut up about it -- so buy it so my friends don't have to listen to me rave about it to them anymore. You really won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Kam D

customer_reviews.title: Look for something else!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 summers ago for a trip to Israel. My family was making fun of me with this gimmicky looking travel pillow. There I was blowing this thing while the rest of the family were already settling down. I was fidgeting to try to get it in a comfortable position. I tried it in so many different directions but it was very uncomfortable and kept on sliding away from my head. I'm ready for another overseas trip. It's resting nicely in my closet and I am now looking for a different kind of headrest pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Ospreyjo

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I used this pillow on a 24-hour plane ride to Bangkok, and I would absolutely recommend it. It's never easy to sleep on a flight like that, but this pillow actually did help. It is sort of half body pillow, half neck pillow, and so it gives more support than the standard neck pillows. Also it's firmer than some of the neck pillows I've purchased in the past which also helps the support. If I had to give one critique, it's that I wish it could be a little softer, but in the end I preferred the support to the softness by far, because it keeps your head in place so you can actually relax enough to sleep. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Makes a world of difference on long-haul flights
customer_reviews.text: I just used this on a long flight from San Francisco to Shanghai, and was able to sleep pretty comfortably in coach for once. I wore it "guitar style" slung over a shoulder, and was finally able to get sufficient neck support to sleep sitting up without contorting my neck. It was easy to inflate, held its inflation pretty well over the course of the flight, and folded up again neatly when we landed. I haven't tried the fleece cover but found the sueded plastic material comfortable enough to sleep on. Especially in combination with a footrest (such as, this pillow can make long-haul coach much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Can't live without it. I have a very nice recliner that I like to take naps in. This pillow makes it possible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ad is Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Everything about the ad, pictures, and description are accurate. This is a good product that gets the job done. This is much better than those neck pillows people have on the plane. I was surprised this product helped me to stay upright on the plane when I slept yet was still comfortable. Rolls up compactly. Easy to inflate and deflate. Quality made. I'm never going to travel without it.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne H

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and it works
customer_reviews.text: The pillow worked as described! I used it in both the cross-body mode, and side mode. It definitely helped me nap better on the plane, and that is difficult for me! I like that it is small to carry, easy to inflate and deflate. The cover could be smoother, but overall it performed very well. I will be taking on all my flights going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Suzm J
